meanings.sent1: The dark, forbidding clouds signaled an approaching storm.
meanings.sent2: The old, forbidding house at the end of the street always gave me chills.
meanings.sent3: The forbidding look on the cat's face made me wonder if it was plotting something mischievous.
meanings.sent4: The forbidding fortress stood tall, guarding the kingdom with an air of intimidation.
meanings.sent5: The forbidding mountain peak loomed ahead, daring any adventurer to climb its treacherous slopes.

meanings.sent1: The forbidding sign on the gate warned trespassers to stay away.
meanings.sent2: The forbidding rules of the club made it difficult for new members to join.
meanings.sent3: The forbidding barrier seemed to mock anyone trying to cross it without permission.
meanings.sent4: The forbidding gates of the castle kept intruders at bay with their imposing presence.

meanings.sent1: Her forbidding expression made it clear she was not pleased with the decision.
meanings.sent2: The forbidding tone of his voice indicated his strong disapproval of the plan.
meanings.sent3: The forbidding glare from the teacher silenced the noisy classroom in an instant.
meanings.sent4: The forbidding scowl on his face warned others not to challenge his authority.
meanings.sent5: The forbidding frown on her face made everyone in the room uneasy.
